inlineContent.text: Provides direct access to a physics body in the
, allowing safe changes to physics properties. This object is passed via the direct state callback of

abstract.text: The inverse of the mass of the body.
If
, the standard force integration (like gravity or damping) will be disabled for this body. Other than collision response, the body will only move as determined by the
method, if that virtual method is overridden.
The inverse of the inertia tensor of the body.
The body’s center of mass position relative to the body’s center in the global coordinate system.
Impulse created by the contact.
Applies a positioned force to the body. A force is time dependent and meant to be applied every physics update.
Returns the linear velocity vector at the body’s contact point.
Types that conform to VariantRepresentable can be stored directly in
with no conversion.  These include all of the Variant types from Godot (for

), Godot objects (those that subclass

’s unique identifier.
Applies a rotational impulse to the body without affecting the position.

Base class for all other classes in the engine.
The inverse of the inertia of the body.
Returns the current state of the space, useful for queries.
Returns the body’s velocity at the given relative position, including both translation and rotation.
Types that conform to VariantStorable can be stored in a Variant and can be extracted
back out of a Variant.

Returns the collider’s object id.
If
, this body is currently sleeping (not active).
Returns the collider object.
Returns the body’s total constant positional forces applied during each physics update.
Updates the body’s linear and angular velocity by applying gravity and damping for the equivalent of one physics tick.
A server interface for low-level 3D physics access.
The body’s center of mass position in the body’s local coordinate system.
Returns the position of the contact point on the body in the global coordinate system.
Sets the body’s total constant positional forces applied during each physics update.
Adds a constant directional force without affecting rotation that keeps being applied over time until cleared with
Applies a directional force without affecting rotation. A force is time dependent and meant to be applied every physics update.
Adds a constant positioned force to the body that keeps being applied over time until cleared with
The rate at which the body stops moving, if there are not any other forces moving it.
Returns the position of the contact point on the collider in the global coordinate system.
The body’s linear velocity in units per second.
Provides virtual methods that can be overridden to create custom
implementations.
Called during physics processing, allowing you to read and safely modify the simulation state for the object. By default, it is called before the standard force integration, but the
property allows you to disable the standard force integration and do fully custom force integration for a body.
Returns the body’s total constant rotational forces applied during each physics update.

per second.
The timestep (delta) used for the simulation.
Applies a rotational force without affecting position. A force is time dependent and meant to be applied every physics update.
Sets the body’s total constant rotational forces applied during each physics update.
The total gravity vector being currently applied to this body.
The rate at which the body stops rotating, if there are not any other forces moving it.
